decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed single and two storey side extension together with the proposed hip to gable roof extension and rear dormer when assessed cumulatively by reason of their excessive combined width, bulk massing, and the side extension's failure to incorporate a sympathetic roof form, the forward projection of the single storey side element and the poor design and placement of windows would form an incongruous, discordant, contrived, unduly bulky and dominant addition to the host dwelling and street scene. The proposal would thereby be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policies D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A., DM1 B. (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).

Reason : 2 - The proposed canopy and pillars attached to the proposed front porch, by reason of its forward projection, prominent siting and poor design would form an incongruous, unduly bulky and dominant addition to the host dwelling and street scene. The proposal would thereby be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policies D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A., DM1 B. (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Alterations and extension to roof to form end gable; rear dormer; four rooflights in front roofslope; single storey front extension incorporating porch; single and two storey side extension; single storey rear extension; external alterations (demolition of porch and attached garage)
